title: Registered Nurse
description:
* ###### **Job Title:**


 Registered Nurse
* ###### **Req:**


 2025\\-1081
* ###### **Location:**


 VMC Main Campus
* ###### **Department:**


 3E Medical
* ###### **Shift:**


 Nights
* ###### **Type:**


 Full Time
* ###### **FTE:**


 0\\.9
* ###### **Hours:**


 1900\\-0730
* ###### **City State:**


 Renton, WA
* ###### **Salary Range:**


 Min $46\\.94 \\- Max $85\\.76/hrly. DOE
  

  

  

  

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**





**JOB DESCRIPTION**





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands, and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.





**TITLE:** Registered Nurse





**JOB OVERVIEW:** The staff RN is a licensed professional who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. This individual provides safe, quality care to these patients utilizing the nursing process as the basis for clinical practice.





**ROLE:** See job description for Clinical Partner for generic job duties.





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Any patient care area.





**HOURS OF WORK:** Assigned tour of duty hours.





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Manager/Supervisor





**PREREQUISITES:**



BSN preferred.



Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.



Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.



AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.



Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility

Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.





**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.



Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.



Adheres to the dress code.



Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.



Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.



Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.



Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.



Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.



Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.





**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**



Must be able to provide safe patient handling as defined in VMC's Safe Patient Handling guidelines and policies to safely and appropriately transfer or move patients (or objects) of varying abilities, weights, and amounts of staff assistance. Must be able to lift from the floor to overhead levels and carry items at waist level weight up to 40 pounds. Requires ability to participate in team lifting. Must be able to operate patient lifting equipment and patient handling devices accurately and safely. Requires the ability to stoop, bend, reach, crouch, and squat. Requires standing and walking for extensive periods of time as required for patient care, moving patients or supplies to other units, hourly rounding, bedside shift report and other nursing duties. Requires full body range of motion including ability to reach from floor to overhead levels, manual and finger dexterity and eye\\-hand coordination. Requires corrected vision, hearing to normal range, and ability to distinguish colors.





**PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:**



A. GENERIC FUNCTIONS:



See generic job description for clinical partner.





**B. UNIQUE JOB FUNCTIONS CHARGE NURSE:**



* Assesses, guides, directs, and facilitates workflow on the unit. Recognizes when it is necessary for the charge nurse to assume a patient assignment and assumes that role.


* Make staff assignments that reflect patient acuity, continuity of patient care, staff competency and the necessity of admit, transfer and discharge activity inherent on all clinical units.


* Mentors staff, float, and agency personnel regarding unit/department/hospital policies, procedures/standards and annual goals and objectives.


* Integrates new staff and agency staff into the culture of the unit.


* Functions as a leader and role model for clinical staff.


* Acts as clinical resource to unit staff. Demonstrates safe use of patient care equipment and can teach others to use equipment safely.


* Identifies resource RN for LPN, PCA, and MST as necessary.


* Monitors and evaluates nursing care given to each patient, by direct observation, consultation, and patient rounds.


* Assesses unit/environmental safety during patient rounds and reports/corrects deficiencies.


* Maintains awareness of Joint Commission standards, state codes, and practice acts. Routinely monitors documentation, compliance with standards, and facilitates rapid turn\\-around cycles.


* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.


* Responds to patient and family concerns/complaints.


* Reports significant events (patient/staff/physician/visitor) to administrative supervisors/manager and activates the chain of command per policy.


* Provides input into performance appraisal of clinical staff on assigned shift by documenting feedback and/or communicating concerns to manager/supervisor.


* Evaluates and provides adequate coverage for breaks.


* Maintains fiscal responsibility by monitoring and adjusting staffing during shift and determines staffing needs for the following shift by utilizing sound clinical judgment.


* Accepts personal responsibility to maintain competencies for direct patient care and team leadership.


* Communicates and collaborates with bed placement and the clinical resource to ensure clinical placement is expedited.


PARTMENT OF PATIENT CARE SERVICES



CLINICAL PARTNER\\-REGISTERED NURSE



Originated 4/15/98



Revised 2009, 2010, 2012, 2013, 10/2015, 5/2021, 8/2021, 3/2022, 9/2022





**CLINICAL PARTNER ADDENDUM \\- Registered Nurse**





**Unit Specific Requirements**



* **Emergency Department RN**


* ACLS within the first 90 days of employment
* PALS within 6 months from the date of hire
* TNCC within one year from the date of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire date
* One year of experience in Emergency nursing preferred or successful completion of ED residency

* **Emergency Department Resident**


* ACLS within the first 90 days of employment
* PALS within 6 months from the date of hire
* TNCC one year from the date of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire date
* Licensed Registered Nurse
* **Chest Pain Evaluation Unit**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience in medical\\-surgical; telemetry experience preferred
* **Post Anesthesia Recovery**


* ACLS, PALS within 3 months of hire
* Current PACU or ICU experience
* **Endoscopy**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in endoscopy
* **Day Surgery**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in surgery
* **Surgical Admissions and Discharge**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience as registered nurse or previous experience in a surgery admissions and discharge area
* **Main OR Perioperative**


* Successful completion of OR nurse residency or 1 year minimum previous OR experience
* **Main OR resident \\-** Licensed RN


* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg RN**


* ACLS Within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Minimum of one year of experience in Emergency/Critical Care nursing required
* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg Resident**


* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **LDR**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Six months of labor and delivery experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **LDR resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Mother Baby**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months of mother baby experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **Mother Baby Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Medical\\-Surgical**


* 3 months of RN experience or successful completion of a residency program
* **Medical\\-Surgical Float Pool**


* ECG within 3 months of hire
* **Medical\\-Surgical Neurology/Stroke Unit**


* ECG interpretation competency within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* 8 hours of Neuro education within 12 months of hire and annually thereafter
* **Medical\\-Surgical or Oncology Resident**


* Licensed RN with less than 3 months of experience in acute care
* **Surgical Joint/Spine**


* Minimum of one year medical\\-surgical experience preferred
* Orthopedic certification within 3 years
* **Oncology RN**


* Successful completion of The Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Oncology Fundamentals Course
* Successful completion of The ONS Chemotherapy Biotherapy Course and VMC clinical chemotherapy competencies
* Oncology Certification (OCN) for all RNs who administer chemotherapy within two years of hire
* **Neonatal Intensive Care RN**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months' Level III NICU experience or successful completion of a NICU residency program
* **Neonatal Intensive Care Unit RN Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire.
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Level III NICU experience
* **Pediatric RN**


* PALS within 3 months
* NRP within 3 months
* Six months of experience in Pediatric nursing
* **Pediatric Resident**


* PALS within 6 months of hire
* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Pediatric nursing experience
* **IRCU RN**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* One Year experience in Radiology.
* Experience in Emergency and Critical Care, preferred.
* **Clinical Administrative Resource (CAR)**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire.
* Minimum of one, but prefer two, years of experience in Critical Care, PACU, or Emergency Services
* **Maternal Child Float Pool**


* NRP and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Minimum 1 year of experience in mother baby, level 2 NICU including CPAP, or pediatric nursing care
* Must be competent to perform patient assignments in mother baby care, pediatrics, and level 2 NICU including CPAP within 6 months of hire
* **Electrophysiology**


* Two years of EP Lab experience
* Registered Cardiac Electrophysiology Specialist or acquired within twelve months of hire
* **General Medicine**


* Chemotherapy Certification obtained within 1 year of hire.

  


  

**Job Qualifications:**


**PREREQUISITES:**



* BSN preferred.


* Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.


* Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.


* AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.


* Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility




	+ Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.

**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.


* Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.


* Adheres to the dress code.


* Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.


* Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.


* Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.


* Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.


* Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.


* Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.

* Assesses unit/environmental safety during patient rounds and reports/corrects deficiencies.


* Maintains awareness of Joint Commission standards, state codes, and practice acts. Routinely monitors documentation, compliance with standards, and facilitates rapid turn\\-around cycles.


* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.


* Responds to patient and family concerns/complaints.


* Reports significant events (patient/staff/physician/visitor) to administrative supervisors/manager and activates the chain of command per policy.


* Provides input into performance appraisal of clinical staff on assigned shift by documenting feedback and/or communicating concerns to manager/supervisor.


* Evaluates and provides adequate coverage for breaks.


* Maintains fiscal responsibility by monitoring and adjusting staffing during shift and determines staffing needs for the following shift by utilizing sound clinical judgment.


* Accepts personal responsibility to maintain competencies for direct patient care and team leadership.


* Communicates and collaborates with bed placement and the clinical resource to ensure clinical placement is expedited.

* ACLS, PALS within 3 months of hire

* ACLS within 3 months of hire

* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in surgery

* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire

* Successful completion of OR nurse residency or 1 year minimum previous OR experience

* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg RN**


* ACLS Within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire

* ACLS within 6 months of hire

* NRP within 3 months of hire

* ECG within 3 months of hire

* Minimum of one year medical\\-surgical experience preferred

* Successful completion of The Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Oncology Fundamentals Course
* Successful completion of The ONS Chemotherapy Biotherapy Course and VMC clinical chemotherapy competencies
* Oncology Certification (OCN) for all RNs who administer chemotherapy within two years of hire
* **Neonatal Intensive Care RN**


* NRP within 3 months of hire

* NRP within 6 months of hire.

* Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.

* Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.


* Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.


* Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.


* Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.


* Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.


* Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.

 Renton, WA

 Min $46\\.94 \\- Max $85\\.76/hrly. DOE
  

  

  

  

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**





**JOB DESCRIPTION**





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands, and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.





**TITLE:** Registered Nurse





**JOB OVERVIEW:** The staff RN is a licensed professional who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. This individual provides safe, quality care to these patients utilizing the nursing process as the basis for clinical practice.





**ROLE:** See job description for Clinical Partner for generic job duties.





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Any patient care area.





**HOURS OF WORK:** Assigned tour of duty hours.





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Manager/Supervisor





**PREREQUISITES:**



BSN preferred.



Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.



Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.



AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.



Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility

Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.





**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.



Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.



Adheres to the dress code.



Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.



Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.



Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.



Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.



Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.



Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.





**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**



Must be able to provide safe patient handling as defined in VMC's Safe Patient Handling guidelines and policies to safely and appropriately transfer or move patients (or objects) of varying abilities, weights, and amounts of staff assistance. Must be able to lift from the floor to overhead levels and carry items at waist level weight up to 40 pounds. Requires ability to participate in team lifting. Must be able to operate patient lifting equipment and patient handling devices accurately and safely. Requires the ability to stoop, bend, reach, crouch, and squat. Requires standing and walking for extensive periods of time as required for patient care, moving patients or supplies to other units, hourly rounding, bedside shift report and other nursing duties. Requires full body range of motion including ability to reach from floor to overhead levels, manual and finger dexterity and eye\\-hand coordination. Requires corrected vision, hearing to normal range, and ability to distinguish colors.





**PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:**



A. GENERIC FUNCTIONS:



See generic job description for clinical partner.





**B. UNIQUE JOB FUNCTIONS CHARGE NURSE:**



* Assesses, guides, directs, and facilitates workflow on the unit. Recognizes when it is necessary for the charge nurse to assume a patient assignment and assumes that role.


* Make staff assignments that reflect patient acuity, continuity of patient care, staff competency and the necessity of admit, transfer and discharge activity inherent on all clinical units.


* Mentors staff, float, and agency personnel regarding unit/department/hospital policies, procedures/standards and annual goals and objectives.


* Integrates new staff and agency staff into the culture of the unit.


* Functions as a leader and role model for clinical staff.


* Acts as clinical resource to unit staff. Demonstrates safe use of patient care equipment and can teach others to use equipment safely.


* Identifies resource RN for LPN, PCA, and MST as necessary.


* Monitors and evaluates nursing care given to each patient, by direct observation, consultation, and patient rounds.


* Assesses unit/environmental safety during patient rounds and reports/corrects deficiencies.


* Maintains awareness of Joint Commission standards, state codes, and practice acts. Routinely monitors documentation, compliance with standards, and facilitates rapid turn\\-around cycles.


* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.


* Responds to patient and family concerns/complaints.


* Reports significant events (patient/staff/physician/visitor) to administrative supervisors/manager and activates the chain of command per policy.


* Provides input into performance appraisal of clinical staff on assigned shift by documenting feedback and/or communicating concerns to manager/supervisor.


* Evaluates and provides adequate coverage for breaks.


* Maintains fiscal responsibility by monitoring and adjusting staffing during shift and determines staffing needs for the following shift by utilizing sound clinical judgment.


* Accepts personal responsibility to maintain competencies for direct patient care and team leadership.


* Communicates and collaborates with bed placement and the clinical resource to ensure clinical placement is expedited.

 Min $29\\.80\\- Max $48\\.30/hrly DOE
  

  

  

  

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**



LPN BIRTH CENTER



JOB DESCRIPTION





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.


**TITLE:** Licensed Practical Nurse\\- Clinical Support Partner





**JOB OVERVIEW:** TheLicensed Practical Nurse, under the direct supervision of the Birth Center Charge Nurses, Assistant Nurse Manager and Nurse Manager, will assist in providing safe and effective nursing care as assigned and qualified to perform in the Birth Center. In collaboration with staff RNs, providing direct patient care, cleaning and maintaining equipment and environment, ordering/stocking supplies in assigned areas and some patient transport are components of the position. The position requires an understanding of the Birth Center's policies and procedures, state and federal regulations and guidelines to assist with the appropriate provision of services. Specific skills also include ability to communicate with the patient, healthcare team, caregivers, families and volunteer supervision as directed by the Providers. The Licensed Practical Nurse may assist staff with the implementation of a new program, quality improvement tasks and may assist with supervision of volunteers with specific tasks as directed by providers.





**ROLE:** See job description for **Clinical Support Partner** for generic job duties





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Birth Center





**HOURS OF WORK:** varies





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Charge Nurse, Asst. Nurse Manager and Nurse Manager





**PREREQUISITES:**



* Current Washington State License as a Licensed Practical Nurse.


* Successful completion of the pre\\-hire WorkSteps evaluation for LPN's.


* Current American Heart Association CPR/BLS for Healthcare Providers required.


**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Capable of comprehending, executing, and acting within the scope of practice of the licensed practical nurse.


* Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.


* Neat, well groomed and professional appearance.


* Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills in a diverse population.


* Proficient in communicating with patients/clients that are from diverse population of age, ethnic, socioeconomic, and/or are physically challenged.


* Demonstrate ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines, set priorities and work accurately.


* Ability to communicate with provider regarding patient care plan, and request assistance as appropriate for positive patient outcomes.


**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKING CONDITIONS:** Follow all Safe Patient Handling policies and procedures and can recognize own limitations with regards to load handling, regularly seeking assistance when demand of transfer or lift exceeds individual physical abilities. This position requires standing, sitting, crouching, bending and walking for extensive periods of time. Must be able to lift/carry 40 lbs. to complete patient care services.





**GENERIC JOB FUNCTIONS: SEE CLINICAL SUPPORT PARTNER JOB DESCRIPTION**





PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: The following criteria reflect fundamental job duties and essential functions of this position but should not be considered an exhaustive list. For example, area of assignment, hours of the position, specialization, availability of other employees, changes in job demands, or the consequences of not performing a task, may affect the identification of, and emphasis on, a particular task as a fundamental job duty and/or essential functions.


* **ENVIRONMENT OF CARE \\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* Complete EOC rounding of department and treatment areas at regular intervals to check on department and equipment maintenance needs.


* Responsible for checking, stocking and reporting inventory levels (including misplaced or lost items) and ordering of supplies for all clinical areas assigned, removing any outdated stock.


* **EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* Participate in identifying risks within team/department and assist Charge Nurse/Manager or Director with developing strategies for emergency preparedness.


* Fulfill his/her role during an emergency and continue to provide care, treatment and services to our patients during the emergency.


* Assist with evaluating the Emergency Operations Plan and assist with returning our department/team to normal operations.


* **HUMAN RESOURCES\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* Assist with volunteer or student instruction and supervision in department tasks as requested or assigned by manager.


* **INFECTION PREVENTION AND CONTROL\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical***


***Support Partner***



* Follow infection control policies and procedures and protocols with specific department equipment and clinical areas assigned within scope of practice.


* **INFORMATION MANAGEMENT\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Complete documentation during shift as close to real time as practical for all patients.**


* **Follow policies and procedures for all patient care.**


* **Understand rules, regulations, and laws related to documentation.**


* **Utilize technology for patient care, process improvement for clinical work and communicate as appropriate. Technology can include but is not limited to: VMC software, email, Internet, voice mail, etc., to create an efficient environment for teamwork and quality patient care.**


* **LEADERSHIP\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Attend and participate in inservices to develop on the job skill sets within the scope of the Licensed Practical Nurse as needed to perform the position for excellent quality outcomes.**


* **LIFE SAFETY\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***




	+ **Once oriented, maintain competence with the use and quality checks on all equipment used during your duties.**
* **MEDICATION MANAGEMENT\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Maintain competence in the use of medications, treatments, dressings and aids used during the course of your care.**


IV. MEDICAL STAFF\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***

X. NATIONAL PATIENT SAFETY GOALS\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


XI. NURSING\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***



* **Provide specific nursing functions within the scope of the LPN and related to direct patient care in the Birth Center.**


* **PROVISION OF CARE, TREATMENT AND SERVICES\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Collaboratively assess patient with care team members.**


* **Communicate effectively with care team regarding patient plan of care.**


* **Ability to inform/notify the care team with/if the patient/client condition or diagnosis changes, or the patient's pain changes, or functional status changes, and the need for re\\-assessment/re\\-evaluation before proceeding with standardized plan of care arises.**


* **Assess patient including pain, as indicated in the plan of care; the LPN will notify/inform the care team of changes in pain per plan.**


* **Follow guidelines within standardized protocols and procedures for specific patient populations within the Birth Center.**


* **Assist care team to provide patients with education materials and appropriate follow\\-up information as directed in plan of care.**


* **PERFORMANCE IMPROVEMENT**\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Maintain awareness of current treatment standards in the Birth Center and other follow\\-up needs.**


* **Assist team in organizing programs, collecting data for review so that patient care,**


**treatment and services can have positive outcomes.**





XV**.** RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE INDIVIDUAL\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***

XVII. WAIVED TESTING\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***





**Revised: 9/2017lm**

* Current American Heart Association CPR/BLS for Healthcare Providers required.


**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**

title: Registered Nurse
description:
* ###### **Job Title:**


 Registered Nurse
* ###### **Req:**


 2025\\-1064
* ###### **Location:**


 VMC Main Campus
* ###### **Department:**


 General Medicine
* ###### **Shift:**


 Nights
* ###### **Type:**


 Full Time
* ###### **FTE:**


 0\\.9
* ###### **Hours:**
* ###### **City State:**


 Renton, WA
* ###### **Salary Range:**


 Min $46\\.94 \\- Max $85\\.76/hrly. DOE
  

  

  

  

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**





**JOB DESCRIPTION**





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands, and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.





**TITLE:** Registered Nurse





**JOB OVERVIEW:** The staff RN is a licensed professional who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. This individual provides safe, quality care to these patients utilizing the nursing process as the basis for clinical practice.





**ROLE:** See job description for Clinical Partner for generic job duties.





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Any patient care area.





**HOURS OF WORK:** Assigned tour of duty hours.





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Manager/Supervisor





**PREREQUISITES:**



BSN preferred.



Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.



Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.



AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.



Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility

Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.





**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.



Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.



Adheres to the dress code.



Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.



Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.



Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.



Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.



Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.



Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.





**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**



Must be able to provide safe patient handling as defined in VMC's Safe Patient Handling guidelines and policies to safely and appropriately transfer or move patients (or objects) of varying abilities, weights, and amounts of staff assistance. Must be able to lift from the floor to overhead levels and carry items at waist level weight up to 40 pounds. Requires ability to participate in team lifting. Must be able to operate patient lifting equipment and patient handling devices accurately and safely. Requires the ability to stoop, bend, reach, crouch, and squat. Requires standing and walking for extensive periods of time as required for patient care, moving patients or supplies to other units, hourly rounding, bedside shift report and other nursing duties. Requires full body range of motion including ability to reach from floor to overhead levels, manual and finger dexterity and eye\\-hand coordination. Requires corrected vision, hearing to normal range, and ability to distinguish colors.





**PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:**



A. GENERIC FUNCTIONS:



See generic job description for clinical partner.





**B. UNIQUE JOB FUNCTIONS CHARGE NURSE:**



* Assesses, guides, directs, and facilitates workflow on the unit. Recognizes when it is necessary for the charge nurse to assume a patient assignment and assumes that role.


* Make staff assignments that reflect patient acuity, continuity of patient care, staff competency and the necessity of admit, transfer and discharge activity inherent on all clinical units.


* Mentors staff, float, and agency personnel regarding unit/department/hospital policies, procedures/standards and annual goals and objectives.


* Integrates new staff and agency staff into the culture of the unit.


* Functions as a leader and role model for clinical staff.


* Acts as clinical resource to unit staff. Demonstrates safe use of patient care equipment and can teach others to use equipment safely.


* Identifies resource RN for LPN, PCA, and MST as necessary.


* Monitors and evaluates nursing care given to each patient, by direct observation, consultation, and patient rounds.


* Assesses unit/environmental safety during patient rounds and reports/corrects deficiencies.


* Maintains awareness of Joint Commission standards, state codes, and practice acts. Routinely monitors documentation, compliance with standards, and facilitates rapid turn\\-around cycles.


* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.


* Responds to patient and family concerns/complaints.


* Reports significant events (patient/staff/physician/visitor) to administrative supervisors/manager and activates the chain of command per policy.


* Provides input into performance appraisal of clinical staff on assigned shift by documenting feedback and/or communicating concerns to manager/supervisor.


* Evaluates and provides adequate coverage for breaks.


* Maintains fiscal responsibility by monitoring and adjusting staffing during shift and determines staffing needs for the following shift by utilizing sound clinical judgment.


* Accepts personal responsibility to maintain competencies for direct patient care and team leadership.


* Communicates and collaborates with bed placement and the clinical resource to ensure clinical placement is expedited.


PARTMENT OF PATIENT CARE SERVICES



CLINICAL PARTNER\\-REGISTERED NURSE



Originated 4/15/98



Revised 2009, 2010, 2012, 2013, 10/2015, 5/2021, 8/2021, 3/2022, 9/2022





**CLINICAL PARTNER ADDENDUM \\- Registered Nurse**





**Unit Specific Requirements**



* **Emergency Department RN**


* ACLS within the first 90 days of employment
* PALS within 6 months from the date of hire
* TNCC within one year from the date of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire date
* One year of experience in Emergency nursing preferred or successful completion of ED residency

* **Emergency Department Resident**


* ACLS within the first 90 days of employment
* PALS within 6 months from the date of hire
* TNCC one year from the date of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire date
* Licensed Registered Nurse
* **Chest Pain Evaluation Unit**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience in medical\\-surgical; telemetry experience preferred
* **Post Anesthesia Recovery**


* ACLS, PALS within 3 months of hire
* Current PACU or ICU experience
* **Endoscopy**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in endoscopy
* **Day Surgery**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in surgery
* **Surgical Admissions and Discharge**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience as registered nurse or previous experience in a surgery admissions and discharge area
* **Main OR Perioperative**


* Successful completion of OR nurse residency or 1 year minimum previous OR experience
* **Main OR resident \\-** Licensed RN


* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg RN**


* ACLS Within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Minimum of one year of experience in Emergency/Critical Care nursing required
* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg Resident**


* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **LDR**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Six months of labor and delivery experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **LDR resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Mother Baby**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months of mother baby experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **Mother Baby Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Medical\\-Surgical**


* 3 months of RN experience or successful completion of a residency program
* **Medical\\-Surgical Float Pool**


* ECG within 3 months of hire
* **Medical\\-Surgical Neurology/Stroke Unit**


* ECG interpretation competency within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* 8 hours of Neuro education within 12 months of hire and annually thereafter
* **Medical\\-Surgical or Oncology Resident**


* Licensed RN with less than 3 months of experience in acute care
* **Surgical Joint/Spine**


* Minimum of one year medical\\-surgical experience preferred
* Orthopedic certification within 3 years
* **Oncology RN**


* Successful completion of The Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Oncology Fundamentals Course
* Successful completion of The ONS Chemotherapy Biotherapy Course and VMC clinical chemotherapy competencies
* Oncology Certification (OCN) for all RNs who administer chemotherapy within two years of hire
* **Neonatal Intensive Care RN**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months' Level III NICU experience or successful completion of a NICU residency program
* **Neonatal Intensive Care Unit RN Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire.
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Level III NICU experience
* **Pediatric RN**


* PALS within 3 months
* NRP within 3 months
* Six months of experience in Pediatric nursing
* **Pediatric Resident**


* PALS within 6 months of hire
* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Pediatric nursing experience
* **IRCU RN**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* One Year experience in Radiology.
* Experience in Emergency and Critical Care, preferred.
* **Clinical Administrative Resource (CAR)**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire.
* Minimum of one, but prefer two, years of experience in Critical Care, PACU, or Emergency Services
* **Maternal Child Float Pool**


* NRP and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Minimum 1 year of experience in mother baby, level 2 NICU including CPAP, or pediatric nursing care
* Must be competent to perform patient assignments in mother baby care, pediatrics, and level 2 NICU including CPAP within 6 months of hire
* **Electrophysiology**


* Two years of EP Lab experience
* Registered Cardiac Electrophysiology Specialist or acquired within twelve months of hire
* **General Medicine**


* Chemotherapy Certification obtained within 1 year of hire.

  


  

**Job Qualifications:**


**PREREQUISITES:**



* BSN preferred.


* Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.


* Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.


* AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.


* Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility




	+ Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.

**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.


* Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.


* Adheres to the dress code.


* Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.


* Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.


* Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.


* Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.


* Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.


* Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.

 Registered Nurse
* ###### **Req:**


 2025\\-1065
* ###### **Location:**


 VMC Main Campus
* ###### **Department:**


 Maternal Child Float Pool
* ###### **Shift:**


 Nights
* ###### **Type:**


 Full Time
* ###### **FTE:**


 0\\.9
* ###### **Hours:**
* ###### **City State:**


 Renton, WA
* ###### **Salary Range:**


 Min $46\\.94 \\- Max $85\\.76/hrly. DOE
  

  

  

  

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**





**JOB DESCRIPTION**





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands, and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.





**TITLE:** Registered Nurse





**JOB OVERVIEW:** The staff RN is a licensed professional who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. This individual provides safe, quality care to these patients utilizing the nursing process as the basis for clinical practice.





**ROLE:** See job description for Clinical Partner for generic job duties.





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Any patient care area.





**HOURS OF WORK:** Assigned tour of duty hours.





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Manager/Supervisor





**PREREQUISITES:**



BSN preferred.



Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.



Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.



AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.



Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility

Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.





**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.



Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.



Adheres to the dress code.



Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.



Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.



Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.



Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.



Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.



Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.





**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**



Must be able to provide safe patient handling as defined in VMC's Safe Patient Handling guidelines and policies to safely and appropriately transfer or move patients (or objects) of varying abilities, weights, and amounts of staff assistance. Must be able to lift from the floor to overhead levels and carry items at waist level weight up to 40 pounds. Requires ability to participate in team lifting. Must be able to operate patient lifting equipment and patient handling devices accurately and safely. Requires the ability to stoop, bend, reach, crouch, and squat. Requires standing and walking for extensive periods of time as required for patient care, moving patients or supplies to other units, hourly rounding, bedside shift report and other nursing duties. Requires full body range of motion including ability to reach from floor to overhead levels, manual and finger dexterity and eye\\-hand coordination. Requires corrected vision, hearing to normal range, and ability to distinguish colors.





**PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:**



A. GENERIC FUNCTIONS:



See generic job description for clinical partner.





**B. UNIQUE JOB FUNCTIONS CHARGE NURSE:**



* Assesses, guides, directs, and facilitates workflow on the unit. Recognizes when it is necessary for the charge nurse to assume a patient assignment and assumes that role.


* Make staff assignments that reflect patient acuity, continuity of patient care, staff competency and the necessity of admit, transfer and discharge activity inherent on all clinical units.


* Mentors staff, float, and agency personnel regarding unit/department/hospital policies, procedures/standards and annual goals and objectives.


* Integrates new staff and agency staff into the culture of the unit.


* Functions as a leader and role model for clinical staff.


* Acts as clinical resource to unit staff. Demonstrates safe use of patient care equipment and can teach others to use equipment safely.


* Identifies resource RN for LPN, PCA, and MST as necessary.


* Monitors and evaluates nursing care given to each patient, by direct observation, consultation, and patient rounds.


* Assesses unit/environmental safety during patient rounds and reports/corrects deficiencies.


* Maintains awareness of Joint Commission standards, state codes, and practice acts. Routinely monitors documentation, compliance with standards, and facilitates rapid turn\\-around cycles.


* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.


* Responds to patient and family concerns/complaints.


* Reports significant events (patient/staff/physician/visitor) to administrative supervisors/manager and activates the chain of command per policy.


* Provides input into performance appraisal of clinical staff on assigned shift by documenting feedback and/or communicating concerns to manager/supervisor.


* Evaluates and provides adequate coverage for breaks.


* Maintains fiscal responsibility by monitoring and adjusting staffing during shift and determines staffing needs for the following shift by utilizing sound clinical judgment.


* Accepts personal responsibility to maintain competencies for direct patient care and team leadership.


* Communicates and collaborates with bed placement and the clinical resource to ensure clinical placement is expedited.


PARTMENT OF PATIENT CARE SERVICES



CLINICAL PARTNER\\-REGISTERED NURSE



Originated 4/15/98



Revised 2009, 2010, 2012, 2013, 10/2015, 5/2021, 8/2021, 3/2022, 9/2022





**CLINICAL PARTNER ADDENDUM \\- Registered Nurse**





**Unit Specific Requirements**



* **Emergency Department RN**


* ACLS within the first 90 days of employment
* PALS within 6 months from the date of hire
* TNCC within one year from the date of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire date
* One year of experience in Emergency nursing preferred or successful completion of ED residency

* **Emergency Department Resident**


* ACLS within the first 90 days of employment
* PALS within 6 months from the date of hire
* TNCC one year from the date of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire date
* Licensed Registered Nurse
* **Chest Pain Evaluation Unit**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience in medical\\-surgical; telemetry experience preferred
* **Post Anesthesia Recovery**


* ACLS, PALS within 3 months of hire
* Current PACU or ICU experience
* **Endoscopy**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in endoscopy
* **Day Surgery**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in surgery
* **Surgical Admissions and Discharge**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience as registered nurse or previous experience in a surgery admissions and discharge area
* **Main OR Perioperative**


* Successful completion of OR nurse residency or 1 year minimum previous OR experience
* **Main OR resident \\-** Licensed RN


* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg RN**


* ACLS Within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Minimum of one year of experience in Emergency/Critical Care nursing required
* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg Resident**


* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **LDR**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Six months of labor and delivery experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **LDR resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Mother Baby**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months of mother baby experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **Mother Baby Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Medical\\-Surgical**


* 3 months of RN experience or successful completion of a residency program
* **Medical\\-Surgical Float Pool**


* ECG within 3 months of hire
* **Medical\\-Surgical Neurology/Stroke Unit**


* ECG interpretation competency within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* 8 hours of Neuro education within 12 months of hire and annually thereafter
* **Medical\\-Surgical or Oncology Resident**


* Licensed RN with less than 3 months of experience in acute care
* **Surgical Joint/Spine**


* Minimum of one year medical\\-surgical experience preferred
* Orthopedic certification within 3 years
* **Oncology RN**


* Successful completion of The Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Oncology Fundamentals Course
* Successful completion of The ONS Chemotherapy Biotherapy Course and VMC clinical chemotherapy competencies
* Oncology Certification (OCN) for all RNs who administer chemotherapy within two years of hire
* **Neonatal Intensive Care RN**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months' Level III NICU experience or successful completion of a NICU residency program
* **Neonatal Intensive Care Unit RN Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire.
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Level III NICU experience
* **Pediatric RN**


* PALS within 3 months
* NRP within 3 months
* Six months of experience in Pediatric nursing
* **Pediatric Resident**


* PALS within 6 months of hire
* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Pediatric nursing experience
* **IRCU RN**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* One Year experience in Radiology.
* Experience in Emergency and Critical Care, preferred.
* **Clinical Administrative Resource (CAR)**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire.
* Minimum of one, but prefer two, years of experience in Critical Care, PACU, or Emergency Services
* **Maternal Child Float Pool**


* NRP and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Minimum 1 year of experience in mother baby, level 2 NICU including CPAP, or pediatric nursing care
* Must be competent to perform patient assignments in mother baby care, pediatrics, and level 2 NICU including CPAP within 6 months of hire
* **Electrophysiology**


* Two years of EP Lab experience
* Registered Cardiac Electrophysiology Specialist or acquired within twelve months of hire
* **General Medicine**


* Chemotherapy Certification obtained within 1 year of hire.

  


  

**Job Qualifications:**


**PREREQUISITES:**



* BSN preferred.


* Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.


* Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.


* AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.


* Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility




	+ Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.

**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.


* Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.


* Adheres to the dress code.


* Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.


* Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.


* Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.


* Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.


* Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.


* Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**





**JOB DESCRIPTION**





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands, and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.





**TITLE:** Registered Nurse





**JOB OVERVIEW:** The staff RN is a licensed professional who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. This individual provides safe, quality care to these patients utilizing the nursing process as the basis for clinical practice.





**ROLE:** See job description for Clinical Partner for generic job duties.





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Any patient care area.





**HOURS OF WORK:** Assigned tour of duty hours.





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Manager/Supervisor





**PREREQUISITES:**



BSN preferred.



Current licensure to practice as a registered nurse in the state of Washington.



Successful completion of a graduate nurse residency program orientation or six months' experience as a registered nurse.



AHA BLS for healthcare providers required.



Preferred for advancement to charge nurse role:


* BSN
* Certification
* Experience\\-Two years' practice in clinical nursing/leadership in area of responsibility

Unit specific prerequisites\\-see addendum.





**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



Demonstrates leadership skills with ability to lead and manage a team, utilize clinical judgment, clinical inquiry, innovation, and systems thinking.



Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.



Adheres to the dress code.



Demonstrates effective interpersonal skills that are community\\-centered, compassionate, and meets the needs of diverse and vulnerable populations.



Ability to communicate and work effectively with the physical and emotional development of all age groups.



Practices in a caring environment with excellent customer service skills.



Functions within ANA Standards and Nurse Practice Act.



Ability to access information and communicate in an electronic environment including but not limited to the use of order entry, e\\-mail, and computer documentation skills.



Self\\-directed in advancing professional practice through continuing education and research.





**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT AND WORKING CONDITIONS:**



Must be able to provide safe patient handling as defined in VMC's Safe Patient Handling guidelines and policies to safely and appropriately transfer or move patients (or objects) of varying abilities, weights, and amounts of staff assistance. Must be able to lift from the floor to overhead levels and carry items at waist level weight up to 40 pounds. Requires ability to participate in team lifting. Must be able to operate patient lifting equipment and patient handling devices accurately and safely. Requires the ability to stoop, bend, reach, crouch, and squat. Requires standing and walking for extensive periods of time as required for patient care, moving patients or supplies to other units, hourly rounding, bedside shift report and other nursing duties. Requires full body range of motion including ability to reach from floor to overhead levels, manual and finger dexterity and eye\\-hand coordination. Requires corrected vision, hearing to normal range, and ability to distinguish colors.





**PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:**



A. GENERIC FUNCTIONS:



See generic job description for clinical partner.





**B. UNIQUE JOB FUNCTIONS CHARGE NURSE:**



* Assesses, guides, directs, and facilitates workflow on the unit. Recognizes when it is necessary for the charge nurse to assume a patient assignment and assumes that role.


* Make staff assignments that reflect patient acuity, continuity of patient care, staff competency and the necessity of admit, transfer and discharge activity inherent on all clinical units.


* Mentors staff, float, and agency personnel regarding unit/department/hospital policies, procedures/standards and annual goals and objectives.


* Integrates new staff and agency staff into the culture of the unit.


* Functions as a leader and role model for clinical staff.


* Acts as clinical resource to unit staff. Demonstrates safe use of patient care equipment and can teach others to use equipment safely.


* Identifies resource RN for LPN, PCA, and MST as necessary.


* Monitors and evaluates nursing care given to each patient, by direct observation, consultation, and patient rounds.


* Assesses unit/environmental safety during patient rounds and reports/corrects deficiencies.


* Maintains awareness of Joint Commission standards, state codes, and practice acts. Routinely monitors documentation, compliance with standards, and facilitates rapid turn\\-around cycles.


* Demonstrates excellent customer service skills.


* Responds to patient and family concerns/complaints.


* Reports significant events (patient/staff/physician/visitor) to administrative supervisors/manager and activates the chain of command per policy.


* Provides input into performance appraisal of clinical staff on assigned shift by documenting feedback and/or communicating concerns to manager/supervisor.


* Evaluates and provides adequate coverage for breaks.


* Maintains fiscal responsibility by monitoring and adjusting staffing during shift and determines staffing needs for the following shift by utilizing sound clinical judgment.


* Accepts personal responsibility to maintain competencies for direct patient care and team leadership.


* Communicates and collaborates with bed placement and the clinical resource to ensure clinical placement is expedited.


PARTMENT OF PATIENT CARE SERVICES



CLINICAL PARTNER\\-REGISTERED NURSE



Originated 4/15/98



Revised 2009, 2010, 2012, 2013, 10/2015, 5/2021, 8/2021, 3/2022, 9/2022

description:
* ###### **Job Title:**


 Licensed Practical Nurse Birth Center
* ###### **Req:**


 2025\\-1074
* ###### **Location:**


 VMC Main Campus

 Mother Baby
* ###### **Shift:**


 Nights
* ###### **Type:**


 Full Time
* ###### **FTE:**


 0\\.9
* ###### **Hours:**
* ###### **City State:**


 Renton, WA
* ###### **Salary Range:**


 Min $29\\.80\\- Max $48\\.30/hrly DOE
  

  

  

  

**Job Description:**


**VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER**



LPN BIRTH CENTER



JOB DESCRIPTION





The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all\\-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.


**TITLE:** Licensed Practical Nurse\\- Clinical Support Partner





**JOB OVERVIEW:** TheLicensed Practical Nurse, under the direct supervision of the Birth Center Charge Nurses, Assistant Nurse Manager and Nurse Manager, will assist in providing safe and effective nursing care as assigned and qualified to perform in the Birth Center. In collaboration with staff RNs, providing direct patient care, cleaning and maintaining equipment and environment, ordering/stocking supplies in assigned areas and some patient transport are components of the position. The position requires an understanding of the Birth Center's policies and procedures, state and federal regulations and guidelines to assist with the appropriate provision of services. Specific skills also include ability to communicate with the patient, healthcare team, caregivers, families and volunteer supervision as directed by the Providers. The Licensed Practical Nurse may assist staff with the implementation of a new program, quality improvement tasks and may assist with supervision of volunteers with specific tasks as directed by providers.





**ROLE:** See job description for **Clinical Support Partner** for generic job duties





**AREA OF ASSIGNMENT:** Birth Center





**HOURS OF WORK:** varies





**RESPONSIBLE TO:** Charge Nurse, Asst. Nurse Manager and Nurse Manager





**PREREQUISITES:**



* Current Washington State License as a Licensed Practical Nurse.


* Successful completion of the pre\\-hire WorkSteps evaluation for LPN's.


* Current American Heart Association CPR/BLS for Healthcare Providers required.


**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Capable of comprehending, executing, and acting within the scope of practice of the licensed practical nurse.


* Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.


* Neat, well groomed and professional appearance.


* Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills in a diverse population.


* Proficient in communicating with patients/clients that are from diverse population of age, ethnic, socioeconomic, and/or are physically challenged.


* Demonstrate ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines, set priorities and work accurately.


* Ability to communicate with provider regarding patient care plan, and request assistance as appropriate for positive patient outcomes.


**UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKING CONDITIONS:** Follow all Safe Patient Handling policies and procedures and can recognize own limitations with regards to load handling, regularly seeking assistance when demand of transfer or lift exceeds individual physical abilities. This position requires standing, sitting, crouching, bending and walking for extensive periods of time. Must be able to lift/carry 40 lbs. to complete patient care services.





**GENERIC JOB FUNCTIONS: SEE CLINICAL SUPPORT PARTNER JOB DESCRIPTION**





PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: The following criteria reflect fundamental job duties and essential functions of this position but should not be considered an exhaustive list. For example, area of assignment, hours of the position, specialization, availability of other employees, changes in job demands, or the consequences of not performing a task, may affect the identification of, and emphasis on, a particular task as a fundamental job duty and/or essential functions.


* **ENVIRONMENT OF CARE \\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* Complete EOC rounding of department and treatment areas at regular intervals to check on department and equipment maintenance needs.


* Responsible for checking, stocking and reporting inventory levels (including misplaced or lost items) and ordering of supplies for all clinical areas assigned, removing any outdated stock.


* **EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* Participate in identifying risks within team/department and assist Charge Nurse/Manager or Director with developing strategies for emergency preparedness.


* Fulfill his/her role during an emergency and continue to provide care, treatment and services to our patients during the emergency.


* Assist with evaluating the Emergency Operations Plan and assist with returning our department/team to normal operations.


* **HUMAN RESOURCES\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* Assist with volunteer or student instruction and supervision in department tasks as requested or assigned by manager.


* **INFECTION PREVENTION AND CONTROL\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical***


***Support Partner***



* Follow infection control policies and procedures and protocols with specific department equipment and clinical areas assigned within scope of practice.


* **INFORMATION MANAGEMENT\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Complete documentation during shift as close to real time as practical for all patients.**


* **Follow policies and procedures for all patient care.**


* **Understand rules, regulations, and laws related to documentation.**


* **Utilize technology for patient care, process improvement for clinical work and communicate as appropriate. Technology can include but is not limited to: VMC software, email, Internet, voice mail, etc., to create an efficient environment for teamwork and quality patient care.**


* **LEADERSHIP\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Attend and participate in inservices to develop on the job skill sets within the scope of the Licensed Practical Nurse as needed to perform the position for excellent quality outcomes.**


* **LIFE SAFETY\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***




	+ **Once oriented, maintain competence with the use and quality checks on all equipment used during your duties.**
* **MEDICATION MANAGEMENT\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Maintain competence in the use of medications, treatments, dressings and aids used during the course of your care.**


IV. MEDICAL STAFF\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***

X. NATIONAL PATIENT SAFETY GOALS\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


XI. NURSING\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***



* **Provide specific nursing functions within the scope of the LPN and related to direct patient care in the Birth Center.**


* **PROVISION OF CARE, TREATMENT AND SERVICES\\-*****see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Collaboratively assess patient with care team members.**


* **Communicate effectively with care team regarding patient plan of care.**


* **Ability to inform/notify the care team with/if the patient/client condition or diagnosis changes, or the patient's pain changes, or functional status changes, and the need for re\\-assessment/re\\-evaluation before proceeding with standardized plan of care arises.**


* **Assess patient including pain, as indicated in the plan of care; the LPN will notify/inform the care team of changes in pain per plan.**


* **Follow guidelines within standardized protocols and procedures for specific patient populations within the Birth Center.**


* **Assist care team to provide patients with education materials and appropriate follow\\-up information as directed in plan of care.**


* **PERFORMANCE IMPROVEMENT**\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***


* **Maintain awareness of current treatment standards in the Birth Center and other follow\\-up needs.**


* **Assist team in organizing programs, collecting data for review so that patient care,**


**treatment and services can have positive outcomes.**





XV**.** RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE INDIVIDUAL\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***

XVII. WAIVED TESTING\\-***see Generic Job Description\\- Clinical Support Partner***





**Revised: 9/2017lm**



reviewed: 9/2017, 7/18

**PREREQUISITES:**



* Current Washington State License as a Licensed Practical Nurse.


* Successful completion of the pre\\-hire WorkSteps evaluation for LPN's.


* Current American Heart Association CPR/BLS for Healthcare Providers required.


**GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Capable of comprehending, executing, and acting within the scope of practice of the licensed practical nurse.


* Able to communicate effectively in oral and written form in the English language.


* Neat, well groomed and professional appearance.


* Demonstrate effective interpersonal skills in a diverse population.


* Proficient in communicating with patients/clients that are from diverse population of age, ethnic, socioeconomic, and/or are physically challenged.


* Demonstrate ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines, set priorities and work accurately.


* Ability to communicate with provider regarding patient care plan, and request assistance as appropriate for positive patient outcomes.

* One year of experience in medical\\-surgical; telemetry experience preferred
* **Post Anesthesia Recovery**


* ACLS, PALS within 3 months of hire
* Current PACU or ICU experience
* **Endoscopy**


* ACLS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in endoscopy
* **Day Surgery**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* Six months of previous experience in surgery
* **Surgical Admissions and Discharge**


* ACLS and PALS within 3 months of hire
* One year of experience as registered nurse or previous experience in a surgery admissions and discharge area
* **Main OR Perioperative**


* Successful completion of OR nurse residency or 1 year minimum previous OR experience
* **Main OR resident \\-** Licensed RN


* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg RN**


* ACLS Within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Minimum of one year of experience in Emergency/Critical Care nursing required
* **Critical Care/PCU Med\\-Surg Resident**


* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **LDR**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Six months of labor and delivery experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **LDR resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* ACLS within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Mother Baby**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months of mother baby experience as a registered nurse or successful completion of residency
* **Mother Baby Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed registered nurse
* **Medical\\-Surgical**


* 3 months of RN experience or successful completion of a residency program
* **Medical\\-Surgical Float Pool**


* ECG within 3 months of hire
* **Medical\\-Surgical Neurology/Stroke Unit**


* ECG interpretation competency within 3 months of hire
* NIHSS certification within 3 months of hire
* 8 hours of Neuro education within 12 months of hire and annually thereafter
* **Medical\\-Surgical or Oncology Resident**


* Licensed RN with less than 3 months of experience in acute care
* **Surgical Joint/Spine**


* Minimum of one year medical\\-surgical experience preferred
* Orthopedic certification within 3 years
* **Oncology RN**


* Successful completion of The Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Oncology Fundamentals Course
* Successful completion of The ONS Chemotherapy Biotherapy Course and VMC clinical chemotherapy competencies
* Oncology Certification (OCN) for all RNs who administer chemotherapy within two years of hire
* **Neonatal Intensive Care RN**


* NRP within 3 months of hire
* Six months' Level III NICU experience or successful completion of a NICU residency program
* **Neonatal Intensive Care Unit RN Resident**


* NRP within 6 months of hire.
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Level III NICU experience

* PALS within 3 months
* NRP within 3 months

* PALS within 6 months of hire
* NRP within 6 months of hire
* Licensed RN with less than 6 months of Pediatric nursing experience

* One Year experience in Radiology.
* Experience in Emergency and Critical Care, preferred.
